title: Release Page
lede: The Producer Price Index (PPI) is a monthly survey that measures the price changes of goods bought and sold by UK manufacturers and provides a key measure of inflation, alongside other indicatrs such as the Consume Price Index (CPI) and Services Producer Price Index (SPPI).

bulletinsAndArticles.title: Producer Price Inflation, October 2014 today
bulletinsAndArticles.markdown: This statistical bulletin contains producer price indices of materials and fuels purchased and output of manufacturing help.

datasets.title: Producer Price Index summary dataset today
datasets.markdown: A comprehensive selection of data on input and output indices. Contains producer price indices of materials and fuels purchased.

datasets.title: Producer Price Index full dataset now
datasets.markdown: A comprehensive selection of data on input and output indices.  Contains producer price indices of materials and fuels purchased and output of manufacturing industry by broad sector.

datasets.title: Aerospace and Electronics Cost indices dataset
datasets.markdown: Cost indices (purchase of materials and fuels, average weekly earnings, general expenses and combined costs) relating to four aerospace and electorics industries.

datasets.title: TSD_MM22 producer Price indices dataset
datasets.markdown: Producer Price indices (PPIs) are a series of economic indicators that measure the price movement of goods bought and sold by UK manufacturers. It is a base weighted index working on the basket of goods concept.
